perturbation.original_text: 1.33 "Detail" means an in-person presentation of the Product and its uses for the Initial Indication made by an adequately trained sales representative during a Call to one or more Health Care Professionals in the Territory during which the sales representative describes the Product and such use(s) in a fair and balanced manner consistent with (a) the Product Label and Insert and any Promotional Materials approved in accordance with this Agreement, and (b) the other requirements of this Agreement, the Promotion Rules and applicable Laws, but shall not include reminder details or e-details, as such terms are generally understood in the pharmaceutical industry in the Territory, or any presentations made at conventions, consulting programs or similar gatherings, other than a pre-arranged or scheduled meeting at such gathering between the sales representative and a Health Care Professional. When used as a verb, "Detail" means to deliver the presentation described in this definition. "Detailing" shall have a corresponding meaning.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.33 "Detail" means an in-person presentation of the Product and its uses for the Initial Indication made by a sales representative during a Call to one or more Health Care Professionals in the Territory during which the sales representative describes the Product and such use(s) in a manner they see fit. When used as a verb, "Detail" means to deliver a sales presentation. "Detailing" shall have a corresponding meaning.
perturbation.explanation: The modification removes the requirement for the sales representative to be 'adequately trained' and to present information 'in a fair and balanced manner consistent with' the Product Label, Promotion Rules and applicable Laws. It makes the parameters of describing the Product to one's own standards and removes legal obligation. This creates a contradiction as the sales representative is no longer legally bound to certain legal requirements when detailing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, Anti-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act

perturbation.original_text: 1.83 "Promotion Rules" means: (a) the PhRMA Code on Interactions with Health Care Professionals; and (b) upon reasonable notice by Janssen to Company, any other similar rules, policies or procedures with respect to the promotion of pharmaceutical products in the Territory that Janssen deems necessary or advisable to follow (including Janssen's compliance policies).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.83 "Promotion Rules" means: (a) the PhRMA Code on Interactions with Health Care Professionals; and (b) rules or procedures with respect to the promotion of pharmaceutical products in the Territory that Janssen finds necessary or advisable to follow.
perturbation.explanation: The modification removes the need for 'reasonable notice by Janssen to Company' and the words including Janssen's compliance policies. This would mean that the business could have rules to follow that are not legally grounded.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, Anti-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act

perturbation.original_text: 3.1.3 Compliance with Laws. Company shall ensure that all of its personnel involved in the activities set forth under this Agreement comply with all applicable Laws and the Promotion Rules. Company shall ensure that the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees Promote the Product at all times in accordance with applicable Laws and the Promotional Materials provided and approved by Janssen, refrain from making any false or misleading statements about the Product and refrain from discussing any unapproved uses of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1.3 Compliance with Guidance. Company shall ensure that all of its personnel involved in the activities set forth under this Agreement comply with all Promotion Rules and other compliance protocols. Company shall ensure that the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees Promote the Product at all times, and refrain from discussing any unapproved uses of the Product.
perturbation.explanation: The term Laws are replaced with Guidance, which is not legally binding. Promotional Materials approved by Janssen are no longer required. This makes the term more open to interpretation, which could lead to non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, Anti-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act
